Carla is disguised as a man and she is selling a \"product\" called Petri tårar (Tears of St. Peter). This product cures every sickness. In order to promote her product she promises to wake up from the dead all citizens of the town who have died within the last ten years. Both the bishop and the mayor are alarmed as they fear loss of influence over them and try to work against Carla. There are also many citizens who don't want to see their \"loved ones\" wake up from the dead. In order to make things more confusing, Carla and the son of the mayor, Mark, fall in love with each other.","popularity":1.442,"poster_path":"/4YEEF724D92E5vyGikJPXrsda5o.jpg","release_date":"1995-08-11","title":"The Tears of Saint Peter","video":false,"vote_average":2.7,"vote_count":3},{"adult":false,"backdrop_path":"/gxmL7J38OiAWO6xvcOI7IXhGAJ.jpg","genre_ids":[12,10749,36],"id":10907,"original_language":"en","original_title":"The Adventures of Robin Hood","overview":"Robin Hood fights nobly for justice against the evil Sir Guy of Gisbourne while striving to win the hand of the beautiful Maid Marian.","popularity":27.221,"poster_path":"/c7LX3GMf9uXQTgVm3uxpm7E6Woc.jpg","release_date":"1938-05-13","title":"The Adventures of Robin Hood","video":false,"vote_average":7.5,"vote_count":720},{"adult":false,"backdrop_path":"/66I1cHGQdFuXhKwh4PsQGQlYSXa.jpg","genre_ids":[18],"id":10910,"original_language":"en","original_title":"Moulin Rouge","overview":"Born into aristocracy, Toulouse-Lautrec moves to Paris to pursue his art as he hangs out at the Moulin Rouge where he feels like he fits in being a misfit among other misfits. Sergei Eisenstein's final film, this is the first part of a three-part biopic of Tsar Ivan IV of  Russia, which was never completed due to the producer's dissatisfaction with Eisenstein's attempts to use forbidden experimental filming techniques and excessive cost overruns.
